channel.title: Credits from stalls

item.title: Credits from stalls
item.dc:creator: @cammyPVPftw cammyPVPftw
item.description:
@cammyPVPftw wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:7, topic:536996”]characterfile.write("Credits = ", 0, 10); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.credits), 0, Integer.toString(p.credits).length()); characterfile.newLine()
try this. "Credit-points = " is like 16 characters long, and you had it set for 11. That can cause the file to corrupt. Also, this is only saving, where is the loading?[/quote]

Fixed, thanks for struggling through this little error with me haha.

Read full topic

item.title: Credits from stalls
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“cammyPVPftw, post:8, topic:536996”]loading

} else if (token.equals("Creditpoints")) { p.credits = Integer.parseInt(token2);

saving

characterfile.write("Creditpoints = ", 0, 11); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.credits), 0, Integer.toString(p.credits).length()); characterfile.newLine();[/quote]
Your loading isn’t loading properly. You need it to be the same string as what is being saved.
"Creditpoints = "
Would be in both loading and saving.

Read full topic

item.title: Credits from stalls
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

characterfile.write("Credits = ", 0, 10); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.credits), 0, Integer.toString(p.credits).length()); characterfile.newLine()
try this. "Credit-points = " is like 16 characters long, and you had it set for 11. That can cause the file to corrupt. Also, this is only saving, where is the loading?

item.title: Credits from stalls
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“cammyPVPftw, post:3, topic:536996”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=655811.msg4389663#msg4389663 date=1387036227]
Make sure you’re clicking the right stall.
Also:
c.credits = (c.credits + 1);
would be easier if you just:
c.credits ++;
[/quote]

Thanks for the help, can you help me with the new problem now? i saved in playersavaing.java, i copied the pkp saving and replaced with my own “credits”. Now i can’t get it to save on logout.[/quote]
Make sure you edited both the load and save in playersave.java
also, show the code you used

item.title: Credits from stalls
item.dc:creator: @cammyPVPftw cammyPVPftw
item.description:
@cammyPVPftw wrote:

I added this code, and it compiled, but it isn’t working. what do i do? case 2561: c.getThieving().stealFromStall(995, 15000 + Misc.random(2000), 10, 1); c.credits = (c.credits + 1); c.sendMessage("You revieved @gre@1 credit@gre@, you now have @gre@" +c.credits + "@gre@ Credits."); break;

EDIT: Got credits working in-game! now i cant make the credits save on logout. they reset back to 0!
